title: Is it good enough
excerpt: It's all too easy to get caught up in making things perfect, incessantly checking for mistakes and errors and nit-picky details of all kinds.

children.text: It's all too easy to get caught up in making things perfect, incessantly checking for mistakes and errors and nit-picky details of all kinds.
To make edits all day long...until you're numb from feeling like this thing, this project, is absolutely perfect.
Thing is, perfection isn't the point. Creating forward motion, shipping this project, changing someone for the better...my guess is that
But if all you do today is make notes of things that need to be addressed later--tomorrow--you'll never ship. You'll merely stall and lag behind.
The alternative is to accept that 'good enough' isn't something to avoid, but something to embrace.
'Good enough' is how you escape the trap of faultlessness. Because, after all, nothing is ever good enough to be perfect.
